lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/stevie.Stevie.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run stevie.Stevie.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
*Stevie* is a task manager and scheduler coupled with an interactive chatbot interface to help you improve
productivity! The desktop application is packaged with a Graphical User Interface (GUI) that resembles
*Stevie* keeps track of all of your tasks! Simple **Add**, **Remove**, **Mark** or **Unmark**
Stevie stores your tasks with a simple `.txt` file. You do not have to worry about excessive memory usage
as you add on more tasks!
Do not worry about making mistakes! With the **Undo** feature, you can revert your command with 4 simple
Having a long list of task? Stevie can help you find your tasks with a simple keyword search. Just type
in a word in the name of the task and let *Stevie* find it for you!
Bid *Stevie* farewell and close the application.
*Stevie* displays a farewell message and exits in 3 seconds.
Bye! Hope to see you again!
### `list` - Displaying a list of your tasks
Shows all the tasks that you have added thus far.
*Stevie* displays a list of tasks that you have in your task list.
Tasks can be marked as done or not done.
You have the following upcoming tasks:
### `help` - Display a list of valid commands
Shows all of the valid user commands.
*Stevie* displays a list of commands that can be executed by the user.
-"mark <i>" to mark the i-th task as done.
-"unmark <i>" to unmark the i-th task as done.
Date should in format of dd/mm/yyyy HH:mm
### `find` - Displaying all tasks that contain keyword
Shows all the tasks that matches with keyword
`[keyword]` is a case-sensitive string of characters that you expect to have in your tasks' name.
*Stevie* displays a list of tasks that you have in your task list that matches with the keyword.
### `mark` / `unmark` - Marks a task as completed or not
*Stevie* marks a particular task as completed or not completed.
`mark` sets the task as completed, while `unmark` marks the task as incomplete.
`[num]` is an integer that represents the 1-based index of the task in the task list.
*Stevie* marks/unmarks the task in the task list.
### `todo`/`deadline`/`event` - Adds a task to the task list
*Stevie* creates and adds the task to the task list based on the type of task specified by the command.
`[task_name]` is a string of characters that represents the name of the task.
`[date]` is a string of characters that represent the date of the task. Date is written in the format
*Stevie* adds the tasks to the task list.
Got it! I have added a new task:
You have 3 tasks in your list.
Got it! I have added a new task:
You have 4 tasks in your list.
### `delete` - Deletes a task from the task list
*Stevie* removes a task from the task list.
`[num]` is an integer that represents the 1-based index of the task in the task list.
*Stevie* deletes the task in the task list.
I have deleted the following task:
You have 3 tasks in your list.
*Stevie* undoes the previous command that altered the task list.
* @param args arguments provided in command line
* A GUI for Stevie using FXML.
private final Stevie stevie = new Stevie();
* stevie.Stevie is a class that serves as a user interface to allow access to an underlying
* task manager. Users can use stevie.Stevie to add in their upcoming tasks/events/deadlines,
* and to mark them as completed when necessary. If you want to use a different location for
* your saved data, replace the path field.
* Path to the save file for task list
private static final String path = "data" + File.separator;
* Task list to store all of user's upcoming tasks
* Ui to receive user inputs and output responses
* Handles saving and loading of user's tasks
* Returns the responses from executing a command. Response can be a string to
* indicate a successful command, or an exception message.
* This class interacts with the user by receiving inputs from the user, as well as, returning the
* response to the user. This UI is deprecated as users can now use the GUI to interact. However, developers
* can opt to use the command line UI in order for a quicker debug process.
+ "\"mark <i>\" to mark the i-th task as done.\n"
+ "\"unmark <i>\" to unmark the i-th task as done.\n"
+ "Date should in format of dd/mm/yyyy HH:mm";

* message to inform user on the commands to properly operate Stevie.
System.out.println("Good bye! Hope to see you again!");
* Prints the response string from Stevie.
* Greets the user when Stevie starts.
System.out.println("Tell me about your upcoming activities!");

* Command class encapsulates the action of Stevie chatbot executing an instruction given by the user.
* To create a Command, extend from the Command class and override the execute function.
* Executes the instruction given by the user. Execute may change the state of tasks,
* write to the data storage, and output a response from the ui.
* @param tasks   task list to make changes on
* @param storage to handle the saving of data
* @param ui      to pass a response string for output
* @param undoHistory handles the history of the commands executed
* @return false if Command does not terminate session with Stevie, else true
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasks, TaskDataHandler storage, StevieUi ui, UndoHistory undoHistory);

* Saves the newly updated task list if a task is successfully deleted. Ui outputs

* @param storage to handle the saving of data
* @param ui      to pass a response string for output
* @param undoHistory handles the history of the commands executed
* @return false to not terminate the session
public String execute(TaskList tasks, TaskDataHandler storage, StevieUi ui, UndoHistory undoHistory) {

* UndoHistory stores the commands to undo prior commands that made changes to the task list.
* UndoHistory stores undo commands in a stack, allowing changes to be undone in a LIFO sequence.
private final LinkedList<Undo> undos = new LinkedList<>();
* Pushes undo command into a stack.
* @param undo command to undo the prior change to task list
* Retrieves the latest undo command that can be used to reverse the latest change.
* @return undo command to reverse the latest change
* @throws TaskException if stack of undos is empty
* Undo is an interface to be implemented by undo commands. Undo commands are used to reverse
* commands that made changes to the task list. To implement Undo, class has to override the undo method.
* Reverses the last command that made changes to the task list.
* @param tasks list storing tasks of user
* @param storage handles the saving of tasks in list
* @param ui command line interface that interacts with use
String undo(TaskList tasks, TaskDataHandler storage, StevieUi ui);
* UndoAdd reverses the last add command by deleting the task added to the bottom of the task list.
private static final String message = "Undo previous add command!";

* @param tasks list storing tasks of user
* @param storage handles the saving of tasks in list
* @param ui command line interface that interacts with use
* @return message informing user that add command has been undone
public String undo(TaskList tasks, TaskDataHandler storage, StevieUi ui) {
* UndoDelete reverses the last delete command by adding back the deleted task to where it was

* @param ui command line interface that interacts with use
* @return response message informing user that delete command has been undone
